title: ‘He’s dead. Soon I will be too’
text:
A FATHER who threw his seven-month-old baby from a 30-metre-high bridge before leaping himself sent a chilling text to his ex-partner saying: “He’s dead. Soon I will be too.” 
Tony Moreno, 23, of Middletown, Connecticut, was convicted of murder yesterday, reports The Sun . Aaden Moreno was found two days after he was murdered. Picture: Connecticut State Police Source: Supplied 
He faces up to 70 years in prison when he’s sentenced in May. 
Moreno threw the child off the Arrigoni Bridge that spans the Connecticut River between Middletown and Portland on July 15, 2015, and then jumped intending to kill himself. Tony Moreno demonstrates to the jury how he held his son Aaden on the railing of the Arrigoni Bridge in the final moments of Aaden's life, during Moreno's trial. Picture: AP Source: AP 
Moreno spent several days in the hospital. Aaden’s body was found by a kayaker 22 kilometres downstream two days later. 
Moreno testified in his own defence, claiming the baby slipped from his arms and he never intended to harm him. 
He was pictured in court cradling a toy doll to demonstrate how he held his son on the bridge’s railing. Moreno in court with the doll. Picture: AP Source: AP 
Defence lawyer Norman Pattis raised the possibility that Aaden may have had a muscle disorder that caused sudden, jerking motions to explain why Moreno dropped him. 
Moreno had a strained relationship with the boy’s mother, prosecutors said. 
Mother Adrianne Oyola, 20, testified that things got worse when she refused his marriage proposal a month before the baby’s death. The two shared custody of Aaden. 
A police officer and a hospital psychiatrist testified that Moreno made statements indicating that he had killed the child. 
Prosecutors also introduced text messages between Moreno and Oyola as evidence, including one where in response to a question about Aaden’s whereabouts. 
Moreno wrote: “He’s dead. Soon I will be too.” 
She replied: “You couldn’t kill your own son. Please don’t hurt Aaden!!!” Adrianne Oyola testifies during Tony Moreno's murder trial. Picture: AP Source: AP 
Middletown police officer Austin Smith went to the Arrigoni Bridge after Tony Moreno’s mother alerted police that he was distressed. 
Jurors heard a 911 call in which Denise Moreno told dispatchers her son said he was going to jump from the bridge and that he was with his son. 
Smith said he arrived at the scene around the same time as Moreno’s mother and brother. 
The cop testified that he shouted “Tony, stop!” before Moreno climbed over a railing and jumped. 
He said there was an empty stroller but the infant could not be found, despite searches for the boy. 
Defence lawyer Norman Pattis said the verdict was disappointing. 
This article originally appeared on The Sun . Parents who kill: What is filicide? 1:17 
According to the Monash University Filicide Research Project, 25-27 children in Australia are victims of filicide. What leads parents to do the unthinkable? Courtesy: Wochit December 14th 2016
